main.name: Shashank Kotturi
main.description: I studied Computer Engineering at the University of Waterloo and I currently work at Cision
main.bio: Currently, I work as an Associate Product Manager at Cision to improve data quality on 1M+ journalist profiles through automation. Previously, I worked as a Product Management Intern at Zighra, SAP and Flashfood. I'm also working on a side project with my friend to create an innovative, relationship building app. My hobbies include biking & exploring new trails, travelling around Canada & the US, and collecting coins in different denominations.

education.degree: Bachelor of Applied Science (B.A.Sc.), Computer Engineering
education.description: Relevant Courses: Engineering Design and Economics, Databases (MySQL), Algorithms and Data Structures (C++)
LinkedIn Learning course that describes the role and skills that product managers posses in the workplace.
Registered PMI course that describes the responsibilities of a project manager and the differences between a product and a project manager.
To understand project management and how it can have a positive impact on my daily activities as a product manager

work.title: Associate Product Manager
work.description: Leading a cross-functional team of engineers and product to bring ML strategies and features to a new customer facing product. ML features include providing recommendations on 1M journalist profiles, conduting topic analysis on billions of articles written by journalists and detecting relevancy of email pitches to journalists.

work.title: Product Management Intern
work.description: Developed a Figma prototype with 20 UI components and increased client feedback by 20% by adding frames with actions that allows clients to interact with the prototype. Won a small business grant worth $50,000 by designing plans for in-app accessibility features. Deployed iOS and Android mobile apps in under 5 iterations by collaborating with app store partners to meet cross-functional rules related to business, technology and privacy.

work.title: Product Management Intern
work.description: Published 11 video tutorials with 30 SQL scripts; Created 4 internal and external product roadmaps in JIRA and Confluence; Presented competitive analysis on 5 data virtualization platforms in the market to executive leadership.

work.title: Product Management Intern
work.description: Cut customer tickets by 40%, costs by 25% and customer wait time by 2 days by redesigning customer support system; Proposed migrating in app event tracking from Mixpanel to Amplitude to reduce annual costs by $100,000.

work.title: Full Stack Developer Intern
work.description: Designed 5 wireframes and created functional prototype for small businesses to customize 10 internet packages with over 20 options each; Eliminated 20% of internal API calls and reduced 30% of Express server usage.

resume.skillmessage: I believe that a Product Manager requires a combination of soft and technical skills (tools, languages and frameworks) to succeed in their role. So, here's a look at some of the skills I've acquired from my previous experiences.

projects.title: Making Relationships with Technology
projects.category: An app that provides helpful tips to create and maintain meaningful relationships.
projects.description: This app is designed to help people start and maintain meaningful relationships. I am currently working with a friend to develop a business strategy and POC to provide an end-to-end solution for relationship management. Features include personalized profile matching, recommendations on topics to chat about, in-app gift purchasing, reminders for special occasions, and more.

projects.title: FoodSaver - Capstone Project Idea
projects.category: An inventory management tool for perishable items to reduce food waste in stores.
projects.description: The FoodSaver project keeps track of item expiry and location within a store. Store managers will be notified of items that are about to expire such that the items can be sold for a reduced price instead of being thrown out. This project improves inventory management, reduces logistical costs of transporting waste, avoids food waste taxes and drives foot traffic into stores.

projects.title: Spotify Headphones - Capstone Project Idea
projects.category: A pair of headphones that can function independently without an external device.
projects.description: The Spotify Headphones idea involves developing a pair of over-ear headphones that can store music on the device, rather than relying on Bluetooth to transmit data. This allows users to listen to music without carrying an external device such as a phone or a smartwatch. This project aims to serve fitness enthusiasts that workout in a gym or go for long runs.

testimonials.text: Shashank was an outstanding co-op. He bettered the company and really took initiative to help out where-ever he could. He worked on items that lowered overhead costs of the business and they've been successfully used in production. Shashank has been a great teammate to the Flashfood team and we would highly recommend him for future co-op positions. We would be glad to have him back in the future if something lines up.
testimonials.user: Stephanie Nguyen, VP, Product & Design, Flashfood

testimonials.text: Shashank has proven to be adaptable to changing circumstances, both within SAP and during the COVID-19 issues that have occurred during the term.  He is very reliable, and works independently, as was shown throughout the term, and especially when he began to work from home locally, and then remotely when he moved back to be with his family.  He was a good team-member, interacting and asking questions when he was not clear on a task or when he needed help. As he settled in over the term, he became more proactive in pursuing his assigned tasks, setting meetings to solicit feedback and discuss progress.
testimonials.user: Jason Hinsperger, Sr. Product Manager, SAP Canada
